channel.itunes:author: Cornelius Fichtner, PMP
channel.copyright: Copyright © by OSP International LLC 2006 - 2012. All rights reserved.
channel.title: The Free PM PrepCast - Sample Videos and Free PMP Exam Prep Material
channel.itunes:subtitle: Helping You Prepare for The PMP Exam
channel.itunes:summary:
Are you planning to take the PMP® exam? Let us help you!
This is the Free Edition of The Project Management PrepCast™, the first true PMP Videocast. We explain the concepts, methods, tools and techniques you need to know about as you prepare for the CAPM® or PMP® Certification Exam. The Free Edition is not updated regularly. It contains actual episodes from the full edition so that you can watch before you buy.
Each episode provides information you need. You can have them with you wherever you go. Preparing for the exam has never been easier!
Visit http://www.project-management-prepcast.com for more information.
The Project Management PrepCast™ is a trademark of OSP International LLC. PMI®, PMP®, CAPM® and PMBOK® Guide are trademarks of The Project Management Institute. All other trademarks mentioned are the property of their respective owners. The Project Management PrepCast™ and its RSS feed are © copyright by OSP International LLC 2006 - 2012. All rights reserved.
channel.media:copyright: Copyright © by OSP International LLC 2006 - 2012. All rights reserved.

item.title: Free eBook: The Short Guide To Becoming A PMP
item.itunes:subtitle: Free eBook: The Short Guide To Becoming A PMP
item.description:
Free eBook: The Short Guide To Becoming A PMP

Are you planning to take the PMP Exam but don't know where to begin? Then begin with The Short Guide to Becoming a PMP, which is your Free PMP Exam Guide. Written by Cornelius Fichtner, PMP, the guide takes you through eight essential steps of preparing for the PMP Exam.

Here are the steps: Assess Your Eligibility, Fill out the Application, Build a PMP Exam Study Plan, Get Essential Study Materials, Learn Study Tips & Techniques, Use Sample Questions & Tests, Get Exam Day Ready and Get Recertified.

You will learn everything you need to know on how to prepare for the PMP Exam. In every step you will receive valuable tips, tricks and resources

Please right-click here and select "Save as..." to download this PDF document to your computer...


Don't see the file above? Right-click here and select "Save as..." to download this PDF document to your computer...

For more information, please visit http://www.pm-studycoach.com.

The PM StudyCoachis a trademark of OSP International LLC. PMI, PMP, CAPM and PMBOK Guide are trademarks of The Project Management Institute. All other trademarks mentioned are the property of their respective owners. The PM StudyCoachand its RSS feed are copyright by OSP International LLC 2006 - 2012. All rights reserved.

Licensed to: The Free PM PrepCast - support@pm-prepcast.com - ad9006b61945

item.title: PM PrepCast Sample: Introduction to The Project Management PrepCast (High Resolution)
item.itunes:subtitle: PM PrepCast Sample: Introduction to The Project Management PrepCast (High Resolution)
item.description:
Introduction to The Project Management PrepCast (High Resolution)

This is the introduction to The Project Management PrepCast™. In this episode we give you an overview of the program by discussing the five Ws :

  • What is the The Project Management PrepCast™?
  • Why should you listen to it?
  • Who is the host of the program?
  • When can I start?
  • How do you subscribe to the program? (OK... technically, that's not a W... ;-)

For more information, please visit http://www.pm-prepcast.com.

Don't see a video above? Click here to play it in a new window...

For more information, please visit http://www.pm-studycoach.com.

The Project Management PrepCast is a trademark of OSP International LLC. PMI, PMP, CAPM and PMBOK Guide are trademarks of The Project Management Institute. All other trademarks mentioned are the property of their respective owners. The Project Management PrepCast and its RSS feed are copyright by OSP International LLC 2006 - 2012. All rights reserved.

Licensed to: The Free PM PrepCast - support@pm-prepcast.com - ad9006b61945
item.itunes:summary:
Introduction to The Project Management PrepCast (High Resolution)
This is the introduction to The Project Management PrepCast™. item.title: Interview with Renata Weir and Mercedes McShane on Becoming a PMP
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Renata Weir and Mercedes McShane on Becoming a PMP
item.description:
Interview with Renata Weir and Mercedes McShane on Becoming a PMP

This is a 1-hour long interview with Renata Weir, PMP and Mercedes McShane, PMP. Renata and Mercedes studied together, passed their PMP exam and are here to tell you their story.

They take us step by step through their journey. We start on the day when they originally decided to become a PMP, then they take us through their studies and finally right into the exam room. We discuss how they studied, what study tools they used and what they think of them. And we also learn that they truly feel that studying for the PMP exam did more for them than just give them a certificate. It gave them a much broader understanding of project management.

For more information, please visit http://www.project-management-prepcast.com

Licensed to: The Free PM PrepCast - support@pm-prepcast.com - ad9006b61945

item.title: Interview: "Simple" Earned Value Project Management with Quentin Fleming
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview: "Simple" Earned Value Project Management with Quentin Fleming
item.description:
Interview: "Simple" Earned Value Project Management with Quentin Fleming

The Project Management Podcast™ is pleased to welcome Quentin Fleming. Click on the link at the bottom to listen to the interview.

<[p>Mr Fleming is an author, instructor and consultant to management, with over three decades of project management experience within private industry. He has particular expertise in the design of and the assessment of project management control systems and is the co-author of the best-selling book "Earned Value Project Management". We discuss the history and the the basics of Earned Value as well as his approach to "Simple" Earned Value which he outlines in an article that he wrote together with Joel Koppelman. The 10 steps, which the authors define are:
  • Step 1: You must define the scope (objectives and deliverables) of the project.
  • Step 2: You must determine who will perform the defined work, including the identification of all critical procurements.
  • Step 3: You must plan and schedule the defined work.
  • Step 4: You must estimate the required resources and formally authorize budgets.
  • Step 5: You must determine the metrics to convert planned value into earned value.
  • Step 6: You must form a performance measurement baseline and determine the points of management control referred to as Control Account Plans (CAPs).
  • Step 7: You must record all direct costs by project consistently with the authorized baseline budgets, in accordance with the organization’s general books of accounts.
  • Step 8: You must continuously monitor the earned value performance to determine cost and schedule departures from the baseline plan: both schedule variances (earned value less the planned value) and cost variances (earned value less the actual costs).
  • Step 9: Using earned value data, you must forecast the final required costs based on actual performance and keep management apprised so they can take corrective actions if necessary.
  • Step 10: You must manage the authorized scope by approving or rejecting all changes, and incorporating approved changes into the project baseline in a timely manner.

Licensed to: The Free PM PrepCast - support@pm-prepcast.com - ad9006b61945
item.itunes:summary:
Interview: "Simple" Earned Value Project Management with Quentin Fleming
The Project Management Podcast™ is pleased to welcome Quentin Fleming. Click on the link at the bottom to listen to the interview. Mr Fleming is an author, instructor and consultant to management, with over three decades of project management experience within private industry. He has particular expertise in the design of and the assessment of project management control systems and is the co-author of the best-selling book "Earned Value Project Management". We discuss the history and the the basics of Earned Value as well as his approach to "Simple" Earned Value which he outlines in an article that he wrote together with Joel Koppelman. The 10 steps, which the authors define are:
Step 1: You must define the scope (objectives and deliverables) of the project. Step 2: You must determine who will perform the defined work, including the identification of all critical procurements. Step 3: You must plan and schedule the defined work. Step 4: You must estimate the required resources and formally authorize budgets. Step 5: You must determine the metrics to convert planned value into earned value. Step 6: You must form a performance measurement baseline and determine the points of management control referred to as Control Account Plans (CAPs). Step 7: You must record all direct costs by project consistently with the authorized baseline budgets, in accordance with the organization’s general books of accounts. Step 8: You must continuously monitor the earned value performance to determine cost and schedule departures from the baseline plan: both schedule variances (earned value less the planned value) and cost variances (earned value less the actual costs). Step 9: Using earned value data, you must forecast the final required costs based on actual performance and keep management apprised so they can take corrective actions if necessary. Step 10: You must manage the authorized scope by approving or rejecting all changes, and incorporating approved changes into the project baseline in a timely manner.

item.title: Interview: Critical Chain Project Management with Allan Elder
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview: Critical Chain Project Management with Allan Elder
item.description:
Interview: Critical Chain Project Management with Allan Elder

The Project Management Podcast™ is pleased to welcome Allan Elder. Click on the link at the bottom to listen to the interview.

Are you struggling to get your projects done on schedule? Are you looking for a better, more profitable way to get things done? Then maybe you should take a look at Critical Chain Project Management. CCPM was developed based on Eliyahu Goldratt's Theory of Constraints and it is the main topic of today's episode of The Project Management Podcast™. We welcome Allan Elder, PMP, of www.nolimitsleadership.com to discuss Critical Chain Project Management. We look at why our projects are late and how the Critical Chain approach will benefit you. Allan can be contacted at aelder@nolimitsleadership.com.

Click here to download Alan's white paper The Five Diseases of Project Management (*.pdf)...

Licensed to: The Free PM PrepCast - support@pm-prepcast.com - ad9006b61945
